ThingDef.label: laser pistol combat module
ThingDef.description:
An arm-like device with a built-in ranged or melee weapon, usually installed onto a person’s upper torso. It consists of two main segments, one for storing and\or producing the necessary ammunition and\or energy and a second one that connects to the user’s arm. It can function without an arm to connect to, but it greatly benefits from having access to a functional biological or artificial limb. It is not precise enough to be used as a proper arm replacement, though it can function as a useful, if not a bit unwieldy, “extra” arm.

A maximum of two modules can be installed onto a person, a primary module that usually connects to the subject’s dominant arm and a secondary module that connects to the other one. Some modules require to take up both “slots” in order to be usable.

Implants like these tend to be given to high-ranking spacer as well as ultratech-era soldiers and mercenaries. There have been reports of similarly-functioning archotech artifacts being utilized by unknown individuals, but their validity is yet to be confirmed.

This particular model is equipped with a slightly modified laser pistol and takes up one “slot”. The warm-up feature has been removed as exploding weapons are immensely more dangerous when attached to the user’s body.
